美国最高法院周五拒绝恢复密苏里州的一项法律，该法律禁止州和地方官员执行某些联邦枪支限制，共和党制定的法律声称该法律因侵犯宪法第二修正案保护的枪支权利而无效。

法官们将胜利交给了乔·拜登总统的政府，他们拒绝了密苏里州官员的要求，即停止联邦法官做出的裁决，该裁决使 2021 年州法律（即《第二修正案保护法》）无效。第二修正案规定了“持有和携带武器”的权利。

政府于 2022 年起诉密苏里州以阻止该法律。它敦促最高法院不要恢复这项措施，认为它违反了一项名为“至上条款”的宪法条款，该条款使联邦法律取代相互冲突的州法律。政府表示，该措施不当干扰了美国枪支法规并损害了公共安全。

土耳其外交部长哈坎·菲丹周五表示，美国总统乔·拜登本周对以色列的访问相当于美国批准对加沙的破坏，并补充说这是“历史所记录的”。

菲丹在接受国家广播公司 TRT Haber 采访时表示，以色列“改变了关于周二参与加沙医院爆炸事件的说法”，并补充说，他希望周六在开罗举行的峰会能够达成一项协议，阻止以色列的进攻。

菲丹说：“当然，拜登在这种情况下来到那里，并在某种程度上批准了对加沙的破坏，这正在被历史所铭记。” “对许多人来说，这并不奇怪，但它创造了一种可能给美国带来许多不同结果的看法。”

他还表示，土耳其正在向对方提议建立担保制度，以找到冲突的持久解决方案，并补充说土耳其已准备好成为巴勒斯坦方面的担保人。他还呼吁其他地区国家参与其中。

周五，朋友和亲戚在贝鲁特举行烛光守夜活动，纪念路透社视觉记者伊萨姆·阿卜杜拉在拍摄以色列坦克向黎巴嫩开火时被杀一周年。

在他在黎巴嫩首都共同拥有的一家酒吧里，亲人们举着阿卜杜拉的蜡烛和肖像，阿卜杜拉报道了过去十年中一些最大的新闻报道，从俄罗斯入侵乌克兰到叙利亚冲突。

“你对我来说就是一切，”阿卜杜拉的妹妹阿比尔说。 “我会继续支撑这个家庭，我发誓。我很高兴你在天堂。”

阿卜杜拉因对贝鲁特港口爆炸的出色报道而被提名为 2020 年路透社年度视频记者。

阿卜杜拉去年在乌克兰执行任务后写信给路透社编辑说：“多年来，我与路透社一起报道该地区各地的冲突和战争，画面中不仅有前线和硝烟，还有不为人知的人类故事。”这触动了我们所有人的内心。”

黎巴嫩军队和政府将阿卜杜拉之死归咎于以色列。以色列军方表示正在审查此案。路透社呼吁以色列进行“彻底、迅速和透明的调查”。

比利时司法部长文森特·范奎肯伯恩周五表示，由于比利时如何处理一名宣誓效忠伊斯兰国并于本周在布鲁塞尔杀害两人的突尼斯枪手案件，比利时司法部长文森特·范奎肯伯恩表示，他已决定辞职。

范奎肯博恩表示，对周一晚上在布鲁塞尔枪杀两名瑞典球迷的 45 岁突尼斯男子的调查显示，突尼斯于 2022 年 8 月提出的从比利时引渡他的请求遭到了比利时司法当局的忽视。

范奎肯伯恩告诉记者：“这是一个不可原谅的错误，造成了巨大的影响。” “我想为此承担全部政治责任，”他在宣布辞职时补充道。

在社交媒体上的一段视频中，枪手自称阿卜杜萨利姆·阿尔·吉拉尼，并声称对此次袭击负责。

他于2019年在比利时寻求庇护未果，目前非法居住在比利时。范奎肯伯恩本周早些时候表示，比利时警方已知他与帮助偷渡人口进入英国有关。

枪手的目标是在布鲁塞尔观看比利时与瑞典进行欧洲杯预选赛的瑞典人。由于枪击事件，周一比赛被取消。

比利时首相亚历山大·德克罗称此次枪击事件是“残酷的恐怖袭击”。

此事发生之际，由于以色列和哈马斯之间的战争，安全问题日益严重，但比利时检察官表示，枪手的动机似乎更多是受到瑞典焚烧古兰经的影响。

8月，在焚烧古兰经激怒穆斯林并引发圣战分子威胁后，瑞典将恐怖主义警报提升至第二高级别。

美国周五发布了一份发送给100多个国家的情报评估报告，发现莫斯科正在利用间谍、社交媒体和俄罗斯国营媒体来削弱公众对全球民主选举公正性的信心。

评估称：“这是一个全球现象。” “我们的信息表明，包括克里姆林宫在内的俄罗斯政府高级官员看到了这种影响力行动的价值，并认为它是有效的。”

一位不愿透露姓名的美国国务院高级官员向记者通报称，俄罗斯因成功放大有关 2020 年美国大选和 COVID-19 大流行的虚假信息而受到鼓舞，从而加强了其选举影响力行动。

这位官员表示：“成功孕育更多成功，我们肯定将美国大选视为催化剂。”

俄罗斯大使馆没有立即回应置评请求。该评估报告发布之际，美国和俄罗斯之间因莫斯科对乌克兰的战争以及一系列其他问题而关系紧张。

他说，这份评估报告已通过国务院电报于周三发送给美国驻美洲、欧洲、亚洲和非洲的 100 多个大使馆，以便分发给它们的东道国政府。

这位官员表示，华盛顿正在私下向受援国政府通报情况，并分享评估结果，“以便在明年即将举行的选举之前”。

该报告代表了华盛顿的最新举措，旨在打击莫斯科所谓的“散布不稳定”的努力，将选举描绘成“功能失调，并由此产生的政府是非法的”。

报告称，华盛顿“认识到自己面对这一威胁的脆弱性”，并指出美国情报机构发现“俄罗斯行为者散布和放大信息，破坏公众对美国 2020 年大选的信心”。

美国总统、民主党人乔·拜登在2020年击败了共和党前任唐纳德·特朗普，后者拒绝接受结果，谎称自己因欺诈而落败。

报告称，俄罗斯在 2020 年至 2022 年间的协同行动旨在“破坏公众对包括美国在内的 9 个民主国家至少 11 场选举的信心”，并补充说，还有 17 个国家成为“不太明显”行动的目标。

它没有指出任何其他国家。

报告称，俄罗斯“利用公开和秘密机制，包括俄罗斯间谍机构管理的影响网络和代理人”。

举例来说，俄罗斯联邦安全局安全部门秘密恐吓选举工作人员、组织选举日抗议活动，并在一个未透露姓名的欧洲国家 2020 年选举中“破坏海外投票”。

俄罗斯官方媒体在 2020 年至 2021 年亚洲、欧洲、中东和南美洲多次选举之前公开声称民意调查是不民主的，并“放大了欺诈的虚假说法”。

报告称，俄罗斯还利用社交媒体平台和“代理网站”散布对选举公正性的怀疑。

报告称俄罗斯是破坏公众对选举行为和结果信心的行动的“罪魁祸首”。

这位官员表示，虽然中国干预了选举，但据评估，中国并未使用这种策略。中国否认干涉选举。

报告建议各国通过制裁、信息共享、驱逐俄罗斯间谍和旅行禁令，努力减轻俄罗斯对选举的干扰。

美国总统乔·拜登周五在白宫会见欧盟领导人讨论中东战争时表示，他相信运载援助物资的卡车将在未来24至48小时内抵达加沙。

巴勒斯坦伊斯兰组织哈马斯于 10 月 7 日袭击以色列，造成 1,400 人死亡，其中主要是平民。此后，以色列对加沙进行了空袭。据巴勒斯坦卫生部称，加沙至少有 4,137 名巴勒斯坦人被杀，其中包括数百名儿童。

当被问及援助卡车进入加沙的情况时，拜登表示，以色列人和埃及总统都向他做出了承诺。

拜登说，“高速公路必须重新铺设”。他说，他相信在接下来的 24 至 48 小时内，首批 20 辆运送援助的卡车将通过。

国际社会的注意力集中在通过不受以色列控制的一个进入点——通往埃及的拉法口岸向加沙提供援助。拜登周三访问了以色列，以色列承诺允许从埃及运送有限的物资，前提是对援助物资进行监控，防止任何物资到达哈马斯。

自哈马斯袭击以色列以来，拉法已停止运作近两周。

以色列为报复哈马斯的袭击，对长 45 公里（25 英里）的加沙飞地进行轰炸，自 2007 年哈马斯掌权以来，该地区生活在以色列和埃及封锁之下的 230 万人的生活状况更加恶化。

围绕拉法口岸开放的外交活动有所加强，埃及总统阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·塞西最近接见了负责中东部队的美国高级将领以及约旦国王阿卜杜拉， 联合国秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯拜访了开罗大规模、持续地提供援助。

总统办公室在一份声明中表示，埃尔多安告诉埃及塞西，“西方对医院、学校和礼拜场所爆炸事件保持沉默”，导致加沙局势恶化。

官员周五证实，墨西哥石油工人工会前长期领导人兼政治家卡洛斯·罗梅罗·德尚 (Carlos Romero Deschamps) 去世，享年 79 岁。

当地媒体报道称，罗梅罗·德尚周四因心脏病去世。

罗梅罗·德尚是 20 世纪统治墨西哥的革命制度党 (PRI) 的坚定支持者，他利用自己的关系成为有影响力的权力掮客，并积累了大量财富，许多人认为这些财富是不义之财。

2019年底，这位工会老板突然辞职，作为国家石油公司雇员主要工会主席的任期结束。

几天前，总统安德烈斯·曼努埃尔·洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔宣布罗梅罗·德尚因腐败而接受刑事调查，但他否认了这些指控，也从未因此被起诉。

罗梅罗·德尚 (Romero Deschamps) 曾担任拉丁美洲最大工会之一、拥有超过 10 万成员的工会领导人，担任过四届领导人，他为自己的记录进行了辩护，指出工人的积极变化，包括养老金和医疗保健的改善以及工资的上涨。

2012 年，罗梅罗·德尚 (Romero Deschamps) 当选墨西哥参议院议员，任期六年，当时革命制度党 (PRI) 的恩里克·佩纳·涅托 (Enrique Pena Nieto) 重新夺回总统宝座，使中间派政党在十几年后重新掌权。

这是罗梅罗·德尚第六次担任联邦议员，此前他曾三次担任墨西哥国会下议院议员，两次担任参议院议员。

“墨西哥石油之门”

罗梅罗·德尚 (Romero Deschamps) 1943 年 1 月 17 日出生于塔毛利帕斯州港口城市坦皮科，是一名注册会计师，他在中部伊达尔戈州的工会开始了自己的职业生涯。

1993年担任墨西哥国家石油公司工会领导后，他掌握了相当大的权力，敏锐地意识到对国家垄断企业征收的税款约占联邦政府年度预算的三分之一。

罗梅罗·德尚被列入2013年《福布斯》公布的“墨西哥十大腐败人物”名单。

然而，尽管其他墨西哥工会高层领导人触犯了法律，其中包括在 2013 年初因欺诈指控被捕的强大教师工会前主席埃尔巴·埃丝特·戈迪略 (Elba Esther Gordillo)，他却安然度过了丑闻。

2000 年，罗梅罗·德尚被指控帮助从墨西哥国家石油公司账户转移 15 亿比索，用于当时的 PRI 竞争者弗朗西斯科·拉巴斯蒂达的总统竞选活动。

虽然政府审计后来发现所谓的 Pemexgate 丑闻涉及 23 亿比索（1.8897 亿美元）的异常情况，但罗梅罗·德尚本人却毫发无伤。其他人就没那么幸运了，受到了惩罚和罚款。

从那时起，罗梅罗·德尚的财富和他孩子们的奢华生活方式成为了更多不受欢迎的头条新闻，尽管据报道，工会的年薪仅为约 23,000 美元。

据墨西哥报纸 Reforma 2012 年 5 月的报道，罗梅罗·德尚拥有一艘价值 150 万美元的英国制造游艇，他将这艘游艇停泊在坎昆的海滩度假胜地，靠近他的海滨公寓，该公寓本身价值约 130 万美元。

同年，他的女儿宝琳娜在她的 Facebook 页面上发布了欧洲旅行的照片，包括与她的英国斗牛犬旅伴一起在私人飞机和五星级酒店拍摄的照片。这些照片在墨西哥引起了媒体轩然大波，Facebook 页面很快就被撤下。

2013年初，墨西哥媒体透露，工会老板给了他的儿子何塞·卡洛斯一辆价值超过100万美元的法拉利恩佐，据报道，这只是年轻的罗梅罗·德尚在迈阿密住所拥有的几辆豪华车之一。

周五，墨西哥总统洛佩斯·奥夫拉多尔在例行的早间新闻发布会上向其家人表示哀悼，并表示“没有人应该希望（某人）死亡。”

“如果这些受保护的披露内容真实准确，则表明 ATF 未能追究其员工的刑事不当行为责任。”

备忘录称，梅内塞斯被安排行政休假，并于 2017 年 4 月被解雇。

ATF 备忘录是由当时墨西哥的 ATF 高级官员编写的梅内塞斯案件的详细摘要，并发送给墨西哥负责调查恐怖主义和武器贩运案件的专门部门的时任负责人。

但目前尚不清楚该备忘录是否已发送。

Niger's ousted President Mohamed Bazoum is being held in a secret location by the junta that seized power in the West African state, lawyers representing him said on Friday, denying accusations that the president had tried to escape.

Bazoum has been in detention since a July 26 coup, and there have been international calls for him to be released.

The junta said late on Thursday that Bazoum and his family, with the help of accomplices in the security forces, had planned to drive a vehicle to the outskirts of the capital Niamey and catch a helicopter ride to neighbouring Nigeria.

Reuters was not able to confirm the account.

His lawyers rejected it as nothing but a concoction, however.

"We energetically reject these made-up accusations against President Bazoum," Mohamed Seydou Diagne, one of Bazoum's lawyers, said in the statement, adding that the junta had "crossed another red line with the secret detention."

The lawyers said in the statement that Bazoum and his family had no access to lawyers or the outside world.

They were previously kept in the presidential residence in the capital Niamey where electricity had been cut since Aug. 2, and only one doctor could visit them every second day to take them supplies, they said.

The doctor was denied access on Friday, they added.

The lawyers demanded that the junta show proof that the president and wife and son were alive.

与邻国马里和布基纳法索的民选总统一样，巴祖姆被赶下台的部分原因是伊斯兰叛乱造成该地区数千人死亡，军方表示比文职政府更能遏制该叛乱，从而加剧了不安全局势。

Bazoum's party and family members say he has had no access to running water, electricity or fresh goods, prompting condemnation from the country's former western allies.

President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Friday Ukrainian forces had repelled a new Russian onslaught on the eastern town of Avdiivka and were holding their ground in heavy fighting.

Zelenskiy and top military commanders visited the southern region of Kherson, where they discussed the situation there and around Avdiivka and Kupiansk, a town north of Avdiivka where Russian forces have also intensified attacks.

"Thanks to all our boys, who powerfully hold the defence and destroy the occupier day after day," Zelenskiy said in a video posted on the Telegram messaging app.

"These days, the Russian losses are really staggering, and it is precisely losses by the occupier that Ukraine needs."

Zelenskiy's office said Russia's assault on Avdiivka had resulted in "record losses" of personnel and equipment, but gave no further details of the extent of the losses.

Reuters was unable to verify the battlefield situation. Moscow has presented the situation around Avdiivka as more favourable for its forces, and each side has exaggerated the other's losses since Russia's invasion in February 2022.

The Ukrainian military said fighting was raging along the front line, with about 90 combat clashes in the past 24 hours. That compares with an average of about 60 daily clashes a week ago.

"The new wave (of attacks) is as powerful as the one before on October 10 and 11," said Vitaliy Barabash, head of the Avdiivka military administration.

"It is very difficult. But the boys are holding out and repelled everything," he told Ukrainian television.

Avdiivka, home to a big coking plant, has long been under attack and has become a symbol of Ukrainian resistance and is seen as a gateway to the nearby Russian-held city of Donetsk.

SITUATION IN KHERSON

Kyiv has been making slow progress through vast Russian minefields in a counteroffensive that it began in the east and south in early June, but Russia has hit back hard around Avdiivka and Kupiansk.

Kyiv says the aim of the Russian attacks is to draw in Ukrainian troops from other fronts and to try to gain ground before winter sets in.

The Institute for the Study of War, a US research group, said Ukrainian forces appeared to have broken through on the eastern bank of the Dnipro River in Kherson.

Kyiv has not commented on the report and Zelenskiy, who also visited the southern region of Mylokaiv, gave no details of the situation in Kherson.

Ukraine recaptured parts of the Kherson region late last year after months of Russian occupation. But Russian forces who left Kherson, the region's biggest city, retreated only as far as the other side of the Dnipro and shell the city from there.

Kupiansk, in the northeast, was also recaptured by Ukrainian troops late last year in a lighting advance.

Protesters from Jakarta to Tunis on Friday demanded an end to Israel's bombardment of Gaza after nearly two weeks of intense air and artillery strikes that authorities there say have killed 4,100 people.

Israel is gearing up for a ground war in the tiny, crowded Palestinian enclave aimed at eradicating Hamas, the militant Islamist group that rampaged into Israeli towns on Oct. 7, killing 1,400 people and seizing hostages.

While some Western governments have voiced support for Israel's military campaign, many Muslim states have called for an immediate ceasefire, with many of their people angry at conditions in Gaza and expressing solidarity with Palestinians.

Protests suddenly erupted across much of the region late on Tuesday after Gaza authorities said hundreds of people had been killed in a blast at a hospital . Hamas said an Israeli airstrike was responsible. Israel blamed a failed rocket launch by a Palestinian group.

In Jordan, which made peace with Israel in 1994, but where much of the population also holds Palestinian citizenship, more than 6,000 protesters marched in the centre of the capital while thousands more rallied near the Israeli embassy.

Protesters voiced support for Hamas, urging it to attack Israel with rocket strikes and suicide bombings, and addressing the Palestinian group with the chant: "We are your army."

Thousands of demonstrators also gathered in each of Turkey and Egypt, two other countries that have long had full diplomatic relations with Israel, demanding an end to the bombing.

About 2,000 people gathered in front of Istanbul's Beyazit Mosque, burning an effigy of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and waved Palestinian flags. Some held placards reading: "Stop the genocide" and "Terrorist Israel".

In Egypt, thousands of protesters stood at the al-Azhar mosque, one of the oldest in the world, chanting "Where is the Arab army?", while others gathered at the central Tahrir Square.

Some demanded military action against Israel, others said Arab states should consider using other methods to stop the bombardment of Gaza. Egypt borders Gaza but has not been able to negotiate an opening of its crossing to allow in aid.

"Palestine is the only country that unites our voices. If the Gulf countries do not send aid, at least they should stop sending oil and gas. That's the least they should do," said protester Mohammed Gomaa in Cairo.

BURNING FLAGS AND EFFIGIES

In Morocco, where the government agreed in 2020 to normalise ties with Israel in return for US recognition of Moroccan sovereignty over the disputed territory of Western Sahara, Islamists and leftists said they would hold a sit-in later on Friday.

Hundreds of people marched in central Tunis, a smaller protest than ones that have rallied there against Israel's Gaza campaign in recent days. Others demonstrated in front of the US embassy.

"The real terrorism is Israel and America, which supports it," said Souhail Ben Nasser, a protester in the Tunis crowd.

In southeast Asia hundreds of people gathered to protest near the US embassies in each of the Indonesian and Malaysian capitals, burning Israeli flags and stamping on pictures of Netanyahu and US President Joe Biden.

"Today we gather here with the same intention to condemn the criminal act by Israel," said Qilla Marisa, a protester in Kuala Lumpur.

Muslims in India staged smaller protests in Jaipur and Mumbai, holding up placards reading "Free Palestine".

Israel's biggest regional foe Iran, and allied groups around the region, also held state-sanctioned protests. In Iraq, Shi'ite militias backed by Tehran mobilised hundreds of supporters in Baghdad near the bridge leading to the fortified Green Zone where the US embassy is located.

On Iraq 's border with Jordan, hundreds of supporters of Iran-backed paramilitary groups staged a sit-in to voice support for Gaza, brought in by bus. "We are going to support our people in Palestine," said one of them, 26-year-old Hussein Samir.

The deal was signed during a visit by Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani to Tunis, where he was scheduled to meet his counterpart Nabil Ammar and President Kais Saied, his office said.

It envisages regular migration channels for "qualified workers" willing to come to Italy, an Italian briefing note said as Rome also promised to help Tunisia in its efforts to stop migrant smugglers and create job opportunities for the young.

"Tunisia is exposed to strong migratory pressure, particularly from sub-Saharan countries, and is the first country for repatriations from Italy," the Italian document said, adding 1,615 migrants had returned there so far this year.

Sea migrant arrivals to Italy have almost doubled in 2023 compared to the same period in 2022, with around 140,000 people coming ashore so far. Some 91% came from Tunisia, prompting Rome's efforts to help local authorities to stem the flow.

Italian Interior Minister Matteo Piantedosi on Tuesday urged the European Union to enact a deal to support the African state's efforts to stop migrant boat departures.

President Saied, who was invited to a migration conference hosted in Rome in July, faced criticism after he shut down parliament and began ruling by decree in what the opposition says was a coup.

As many as 80% of Israelis believe Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu must take responsibility for the security failures exposed by the devastating Oct. 7 assault on Israeli by Hamas, a poll in the Ma'ariv newspaper showed on Friday.

The army chief of staff, the head of military intelligence and the head of the Shin Bet intelligence service have all admitted their services failed to prevent the attack, in which some 1,400 Israelis were killed on the deadliest day in Israel's 75-year-old history.

Netanyahu's coalition partner, Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, has also said the government leadership and security leadership had failed to protect the country but the premier himself has yet to make a clear statement of responsibility.

Netanyahu said this week that there are many questions regarding the Oct. 7 attack and "we will investigate everything thoroughly".

Even among voters of Netanyahu's ruling Likud party, 69% said he should accept responsibility.

The survey showed Netanyahu lagging far behind former Defence Minister Benny Gantz, head of an opposition centrist party who joined a unity government last week. It said 48% of respondents thought Gantz would make a better prime minister, compared with only 28% for Netanyahu.

The poll indicated that 65% of Israelis were in support of the expected ground invasion of Gaza by Israeli troops.

The poll was conducted on Oct. 18 and 19 among 510 respondents and had a 4.3% margin of error, Ma'ariv said.

The US House of Representatives is due to hold a third vote to fill its vacant speaker's chair on Friday, but Republicans who control the chamber appear no closer to resolving a leadership battle that has paralyzed the House for more than two weeks.

Outspoken conservative Jim Jordan , who has twice failed this week to win the job, is expected to make a third attempt when the House opens for business at 10:00 am ET (1400 GMT) on Friday.

His opponents say he is likely to fare worse this time than he has before.

Republican infighting has left Congress unable to act on President Joe Biden's request for aid to Ukraine and Israel.

The narrow and fractious Republican majority has failed to unite behind Jordan or any other candidate to replace Speaker Kevin McCarthy , who was ousted by a handful of party members on Oct. 3. They also have been unable to agree on a fallback plan that would let the chamber take up legislation.

Jordan has failed to win the 217 votes needed to claim the speaker's gavel in votes on Tuesday and Wednesday.

He met privately on Thursday with some of the 22 Republicans who have voted against him.

But the holdouts, some of whom have received death threats , said they were unmoved.

"We all told him that we're solid no's. That was the discussion. Now he's got a decision to make," Republican Representative Vern Buchanan told reporters after the meeting.

Republicans control the House by a 221-212 margin, and Jordan has not gotten more than 200 votes so far.

A third failed vote could prompt Jordan to drop out, which would clear the way for other candidates to emerge. But it is unclear whether Republicans will be able to unite behind any of them.

Republicans also are divided on a backup option that could allow the chamber to address pressing matters, like Biden's aid package and spending legislation that would allow the US government to keep functioning beyond a Nov. 17 deadline.

That plan would give more authority to Republican Representative Patrick McHenry, who is filling the speaker's chair on a temporary basis. House Democrats and the White House have said they are open to the idea, but Republicans rejected that approach in a closed-door meeting on Thursday.

The impasse has exposed sharp divisions between Republicans who aim to work within the rules of Washington politics and a hard-right faction that has taken the US government to the brink of default and the edge of a shutdown.

Investors say the turmoil on Capitol Hill is also contributing to market volatility .

"People are really trying to figure out how they can unite around a body that has really done this self-inflicting wound," said Republican Representative Kat Cammack.

Jordan has built his reputation as a leader of that uncompromising right flank. His backers say that would make him an effective fighter for conservative policies in a town where Democrats control the Senate and the White House.

A close ally of Donald Trump, Jordan was a "significant player" in the former president's attempts to overturn Biden's 2020 election win, according to a congressional investigation. He helped to engineer government shutdowns in 2013 and 2018 and helped to pushed Republican Speaker John Boehner into retirement in 2015.

As chair of the Judiciary Committee, he is a leader of an impeachment inquiry into Biden that has so far turned up no evidence of wrongdoing by the president.

随着中东地区对以色列袭击加沙的愤怒日益加剧，中国和俄罗斯正在与该地区国家寻找支持巴勒斯坦人的共同目标。

对于莫斯科和北京来说，哈马斯袭击造成 1,400 名以色列人死亡后，以色列对加沙的轰炸提供了一个机会来提升他们作为发展中国家冠军的信誉，这与美国形成鲜明对比，美国完全支持盟友以色列。

中国一贯呼吁克制和停火，但也加大了对以色列的批评力度。

据中国官方媒体报道，中国外交部长王毅本周表示，“以色列的行为超出了自卫范围”，并呼吁以色列停止对加沙居民的“集体惩罚”。

俄罗斯对巴勒斯坦人表示同情，同时指责美国“我认为很多人都会同意我的观点，这是美国中东政策失败的生动例子，”俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京本周表示。

普京和中国国家主席习近平都寻求深化与南半球的联系，看到了经济机会，并可能找到平衡美国及其盟国外交影响力的方法。

本周，中国主办了习近平标志性的“一带一路”倡议峰会，该倡议为中东、非洲、拉丁美洲和亚洲的基础设施项目提供了数千亿美元的贷款。

中国表示，普京出席并会见了习近平，进行了三个小时的会谈，其中包括“就巴以局势深入交换了意见”。

华盛顿战略与国际研究中心中东项目主任乔恩·奥尔特曼表示：“中国和俄罗斯更多地从美国角度看待（这场危机），而不是巴勒斯坦或以色列。”

“如果美国能够有效地团结世界，这对他们来说是不利的。如果美国及其盟友变得越来越孤立，他们会认为这对他们有利。”

支持巴勒斯坦

尽管俄罗斯和中国在中东的战略并不完全一致，但它们有很多共同点。

俄罗斯对美国持尖锐批评态度，但中国基本上避免批评美国，这与乌克兰战争初期形成鲜明对比，当时中国对俄罗斯的支持使其外交立场成为不受欢迎的焦点。

今年，中国出人意料地宣布了一项关于恢复沙特阿拉伯和伊朗关系的协议，这表明其在中东的影响力日益增强。

俄罗斯也一直在改善与伊朗的关系，其中包括供应伊朗无人机以及支持叙利亚总统巴沙尔·阿萨德的共同事业。

中国和俄罗斯都有支持巴勒斯坦人的历史，并且都批评美国将巴勒斯坦人边缘化。

新加坡国立大学中东研究所高级研究员让-卢普·萨马安表示：“强调美国在冲突中的负面作用显然是双方的共同利益。”

“这符合他们关于需要建立一个替代美国的世界秩序的更广泛的叙述”

俄罗斯官方媒体表示，正在向加沙提供人道主义援助，中国已派遣中东特使前往该地区，并在那里会见了俄罗斯特别代表。俄罗斯周四表示正在与中国协调中东政策。

尽管中国媒体于 10 月 7 日报道了哈马斯袭击事件，但此后的报道中出现了巴勒斯坦人遭受苦难的画面，其中一些媒体特别援引巴勒斯坦消息人士的话说，以色列对此负有责任。

“10 月 7 日震惊世界的现实并没有出现在中国新闻中。相反，新闻报道了以色列对加沙的轰炸，但没有解释目标只是哈马斯的基础设施，”SIGNAL 集团董事卡里斯·维特 (Carice Witte) 说道。总部设在特拉维夫的中以关系智库。

寻求盟友

俄罗斯在乌克兰的战争进一步激励其与巴勒斯坦事业结盟。

美国一直试图说服南半球国家团结起来支持乌克兰，但收效甚微。将美国描绘成冲突的推动者有助于削弱这种努力。

奥尔特曼认为中国也有类似的动机，中国将美国视为主要的地缘政治竞争对手。

奥尔特曼表示：“尽管中国与以色列关系密切，但它正试图打全球南方牌。它不仅实际上支持哈马斯，而且还在悄悄帮助抵制美国为以色列争取国际支持的努力。”

中东问题专家、浙江外国语大学教授马晓林表示，中国在巴勒斯坦和以色列之间保持不偏不倚，但如果受到推动，中国将站在阿拉伯伙伴一边。

马说：“如果以色列在美国的支持下扩大战争规模和范围，造成更多人道主义伤亡，中国肯定会让天平向有利于巴勒斯坦的方向倾斜。”

美国总统乔·拜登周四要求美国再花费数十亿美元帮助以色列打击哈马斯，而以色列国防部长则告诉他的军队准备进入加沙地带摧毁巴勒斯坦激进组织。

拜登在周四晚间的白宫电视讲话中也谈到了乌克兰击退俄罗斯入侵的努力，他表示哈马斯试图“消灭”以色列的民主。

总统周三对以色列进行了八小时的访问，他还强调了向加沙缺乏食物、水和药品的巴勒斯坦平民提供救济的紧迫性。

他说：“我们不能忽视无辜巴勒斯坦人的人性，他们只想和平生活并拥有机会。”

拜登表示，他将在周五请求国会批准向以色列提供额外资金。一位熟悉此事的消息人士早些时候表示，这笔资金总额将达到 140 亿美元。

拜登表示，这笔资金将“增强以色列的质量优势”并增强其军事能力。

他说，美国的国家安全要求它支持以色列等“关键伙伴”。拜登说：“这是一项明智的投资，将为美国几代人的安全带来红利。”

在加沙地带，以色列似乎越来越接近全面入侵哈马斯统治的海滨飞地。以色列军队在加沙边境附近集结了部队和装备。

“你现在从远处看到加沙，你很快就会从内部看到它。命令将会到来，”以色列国防部长约阿夫·加兰特周四告诉聚集在加沙边境的部队。

10 月 7 日，哈马斯枪手造成 1,400 名以色列人死亡，以色列对加沙进行了空袭。以色列已将加沙地带的 230 万人置于围困之中，并发出全面入侵的信号。

约旦外交部长艾曼·萨法迪在安曼对记者说：“所有迹象都表明最糟糕的情况即将到来。”

加沙平民表示，由于食物、水、燃料和医疗用品短缺，他们的处境越来越绝望。据巴勒斯坦卫生官员称，约 3,500 人被杀，超过一百万人无家可归。

援助行动缓慢

在周三对特拉维夫进行八小时的访问期间，拜登试图促成一项向加沙提供援助的协议，但收效甚微。他说，以色列和埃及同意 20 辆载有救援物资的卡车可以进入该飞地。两名埃及安全部门消息人士称，设备已于周四通过其边境口岸发送，用于修复加沙一侧的道路。超过100辆卡车在埃及等候。

由于以色列对边境巴勒斯坦一侧的轰炸，该过境点已停止运作。

虽然一些官员此前预计援助将于周五进入加沙，但这种机会似乎在减少。美国国务院表示，新任命的美国中东人道主义问题特使戴维·萨特菲尔德仍在与以色列和埃及官员就援助运送的“确切方式”进行谈判。

一再拖延和障碍，以色列要求保证救援物资不会被哈马斯武装分子侵占。

联合国呼吁提供援助，使其恢复到冲突前每天 100 辆卡车的水平。秘书长安东尼奥·古特雷斯计划周五访问从埃及到加沙的拉法过境点，以色列驻联合国大使吉拉德·埃尔丹在纽约市的一次集会上表示，此举表明“他的首要任务是向恐怖分子提供援助。 ”

加沙以外的爆发点

与此同时，周三加沙医院爆炸激怒了阿拉伯世界，而以色列预计的地面入侵也加剧了人们对冲突蔓延的担忧。

巴勒斯坦人将医院爆炸归咎于以色列空袭，但以色列表示这是巴勒斯坦武装分子火箭发射失败造成的。拜登支持以色列的账户。

五角大楼周四表示，一艘美国海军军舰拦截了胡塞运动从也门向以色列发射的三枚巡航导弹和几架无人机。胡塞武装和哈马斯一样，都得到伊朗的支持。

伊朗的另一个盟友黎巴嫩激进组织真主党表示，周四，在边境暴力事件发生 17 年来最严重的升级后，他们周四向马纳拉村的以色列阵地发射了火箭弹，并招致以色列炮火回击。

黎巴嫩安全部门消息人士和联合国维和部队表示，该地区有一名平民被杀。

黎巴嫩军方表示，周四，一名记者在黎巴嫩南部边境地区被以色列枪杀，以色列军队与真主党在该地区发生激烈交火。黎巴嫩军方表示，七名媒体人员在交火中被困，并要求联合国维和人员将他们营救。

以色列军方在被问及黎巴嫩军队的说法时表示，正在调查此事。上周，一名路透社记者在黎巴嫩南部被杀，其他记者受伤。

巴勒斯坦红新月会周四表示，由于担心约旦河西岸可能成为更广泛战争的第三条战线，约旦河西岸城市图勒凯尔姆的努尔沙姆斯难民营与以色列军队发生冲突，造成 13 名巴勒斯坦人死亡。

哈马斯武装派别发言人阿布·奥贝达在半岛电视台呼吁周五在阿拉伯和穆斯林国家举行反以色列集会，并表示该组织已准备好与以色列进行长期战斗。
